text: Does anyone have advice about how to remotely collaborate on a single Pluto notebook?

attachments.title: ngrok - secure introspectable tunnels to localhost
attachments.text: ngrok secure introspectable tunnels to localhost webhook development tool and debugging tool
attachments.fallback: ngrok - secure introspectable tunnels to localhost

text: I have done this with Fons. It’s great

elements.text: I have done this with Fons. It’s great

text: +1 for ngrok! It does expose your localhost to anyone who visits the (random) generated url, so if security is a concern you can do `ngrok http -auth="username:password" 1234` to protect the page with some credentials (you do need to have a (free) ngrok account to set this up). You could even include the credentials in the ngrok link like this: `<https://username>:password@<ngrok numbers>.<http://ngrok.io|ngrok.io>` so it automatically logs in (ofc you should only send this link to people you trust)

text: You have to be careful though with things like Sliders. They update on one client but not the other.
